intro: Epilobium dodonaei var. stevenii, commonly known as Steven's willowherb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Native to the western United States, it thrives in moist, disturbed soils such as streambanks and meadows. This variant is often distinguished from other Epilobium species by its specific floral morphology and geographic distribution.
